page.title: 04OUR SCHOOL CENTENARY.
page.content: { } Last year{(1984)}our school was 100 years old.We had a{celebration week. { }On Monday we had a{Victorian {breakfast,}where we all dressed in Victorian clothes.We performed a{ {concert}about all the things that have happened at the school in the last hundred years. Mrs Bache, our ex-headmisstress was the narrator. There was choral speakng, singing, dancing and a Victorian school set. We also had special tee-shirts and sweat-shirts, with small circles in the corner of the shirts with "The Down County School 1884_1984 Centenary" on them.We all played Victorian games and the classroom was laid out with the tables in two long rows.We did{Victorian}work from a black-board.We all had numbers for when we went in and out of the classroom.
